text.title: Make Kataif
text.head: Make Kataif
text.p: Kataif , typically eaten during the month of Ramadan , is a Middle Eastern sweet that can be made in a number of ways . Kataif is eaten in many of the countries in the Middle East but mostly in Palestine , Syria , Jordan , and Lebanon . The recipe below provides a few ways to create these tasty sweets . Perfect dessert for those celebrating Ramadan and for those who simply enjoy trying Middle Eastern desserts . Quantity:12-15 Time to make:30-40 min
text.head: Ingredients
Batter

list.item: 1/3 cup of pancake mix ( Aunt Jemimah pancake mix compete )

text.head: Filling
Syrup
Steps

list.item: Find a clean surface . Make sure to work in an environment that is clean and spacious so that nothing gets dirty and messy .

Prepare the batter . Get a blender and place the 1/3 cups of flour , 1 cup of semolina , 1/2 teaspoon of ground mahlab , 1/2 teaspoon of yeast , 1/3 cup of sugar , 1/3 cup of pancake mix , and 1 cup of water ( may require 1/2 a cup more until the batter becomes smooth ) into it . Blend the batter until it gets smooth .
Heat frying pan . pour the mix i a large bowl and allow the it to rest for 10-15 minutes while the pan heats up . Make sure it is on medium to low heat and that the batter is covered .

Pour the mix . Once to batter has rested , use a ladle and pour about 1/4 cup onto the frying pan . Notice that the kataif will start to bubble around the edges and soon will start to cover the entire surface . If it is not covered with bubbles , then that means that the batter is too thick . if that is the case add small quantities of water , whisk and try again .

Remove the kataif . When it is no longer shiny and liquidy , then they are ready to be removed from the pan .
NOTE : cooking them over high heat will cause them to get burnt quickly and will dry them out . That will cause them to split when they are filled or will reopen . you want to color to be a golden brown so check with the first one , if its too dark , lower the heat and try again . if it is too light , brig the heat up a little .
,

Cover them with a towel . Take the kataif off the heat and immediately cover them with a kitchen towel or a light blanket . THIS IS VERY IMPORTANT ! Covering them allows the kataif to remain soft and easy to stuff and seal without worrying about it splitting .
NOTE : if you do not cover the kataif they will dry out and the results will be that it will no longer seal and it will begin to split .

Prepare the fillings . Take 1/2 block of 1 Ib . white sweet cheese and begin shredding it with a shredder into a plate until you feel is enough for the portion . An alternative filling is ricotta :
Take 2 cups of toasted almonds/walnuts that are chopped or crushed , 1 tablespoon of sugar , 2 teaspoons of cinnamon , and 1/4 teaspoon of cardamon and place them into a small mixing bowl and mix them .

Stuff the kataif . To stuff the kataif , place about 1-2 teaspoons of the desired filling into the middle of the kataif and fold it in half . At this point it should look like a half moon . Then begin to seal the edges by pinching them , with your thumb and index , tightly together . once sealed , place them back under the covers and begin working on the syrup .
Make sure you do n't over stuff them because that may cause them to burst open during cooking .
,
,

Making the Syrup . Take 1 cup of sugar , 3/4 cup of water , and 1 teaspoon of lemon juice and placed them in a pot to boil . once it has reached its boiling point , lower the heat and let it simmer for 5 minutes After simmering is done , turn off the heat totally and add 1 teaspoon of rosewater .
Some people replace the rosewater with cinnamon or orange peel .

Frying the Kataifi . Grab a pot and pour about 2-3 cups of vegetable oil in it and turn on the heat , once the oil begins to boil , place the 2 or 3 kataif into the pot at a time and fry it util the edges become crisp and golden brown .
NOTE : Baking the kataif is another method . brush the kataif wit melted butter or vegetable oil and arrange them on a blanket sheet . Bake them in a preheated oven at 200C until golden and crisp .

Soak with syrup . Once the kataif is finished being fried or bakes , take it and quickly dunk them into the syrup and then arrange them on a serving plate .
NOTE : do not dunk them for more than a few seconds of else they will become soggy and soft .

Make tea . In most middle eastern cultures , it is traditionally eaten with tea . Take a tea pot and fill it up with water . When you see that the water has boiled , place two bags of Lipton black tea and either a handful of mint leaves or sage ( maramia ) . Turn off immediately and let it brew for about 5 min . Once it has finished , pour in into a cup with about 2 teaspoons of sugar and enjoy it with kataif .
